intro: Acourtia discolor, commonly known as the white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Acourtia discolor is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
